headline: Skillsoft Teams Up With Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) To Elevate AI-Powered Customer Support And Engagement
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) recently announced a collaboration with Skillsoft to integrate AI-powered upskilling into its platform, aligning with news that the Indiana Fever is implementing Salesforce's Agentforce to enhance fan engagement. These developments underscore Salesforce's commitment to innovation in workforce management and customer engagement. However, these initiatives coincided with a market environment where indexes, including the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, reached their highest levels...

headline: Indiana Fever, Pacers Sports & Entertainment Tap Salesforce to Scale Fan Engagement with Agentic AI
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, June 11, 2025--Salesforce (NYSE: CRM), the world’s #1 AI CRM, today announced that the Indiana Fever and its parent organization Pacers Sports & Entertainment (PS&E) are deploying Agentforce, Salesforce’s digital labor platform, to autonomously scale deeper, more personalized connections with their rapidly expanding fanbase and augment its marketing and sales teams with agentic AI.

headline: Salesforce locks Slack out of AI competition
summary: Faced with the rise of artificial intelligence, Slack, owned by Salesforce, is tightening access to its data. By modifying its terms of use, the collaborative messaging service is cutting the ground...

headline: Salesforce blocks AI rivals from using Slack data, The Information reports
summary: A spokesperson for Salesforce said the company had recently made changes to its terms and services and directed Reuters to a May 29 statement on its website.  "As AI raises critical considerations around how customer data is handled, we’re committed to delivering AI and data services in a way that’s thoughtful and transparent," the spokesperson said.  Salesforce in its May statement said it was "reinforcing safeguards around how data accessed via Slack APIs can be stored, used, and shared."
